title: Authors and Citation
text: Kenny C (2022). svc: Build Seats-Votes Curves. https://github.com/christopherkenny/svc, http://christophertkenny.com/svc/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {svc: Build Seats-Votes Curves},   author = {Christopher T. Kenny},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/christopherkenny/svc, http://christophertkenny.com/svc/}, }

title: Build Seats-Votes Curves
text: can install development version svc GitHub :

title: Build Seats-Votes Curves
text: First load svc , can use redist example Iowa data get redist_plans object column Democratic voteshares. data ready, can make Seats-Votes curve.
code: library(svc) library(redist) #> Warning: package 'redist' was built under R version 4.2.1 #> Loading required package: redistmetrics #>  #> Attaching package: 'redist' #> The following object is masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter data(iowa) ia <- redist_map(iowa, existing_plan = cd_2010, pop_tol = 0.01) plans <- redist_smc(ia, 100, silent = TRUE) plans <- plans %>% dplyr::mutate(dvs = group_frac(ia, dem_08, dem_08 + rep_08)) svc(plans, dvs)

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.

title: Make a Seats-Votes Curve — svc
text: plans redist_plans object dvs <tidy-select> column plans swing function swing voteshares

title: Make a Seats-Votes Curve — svc
code: library(redist) #> Loading required package: redistmetrics #>  #> Attaching package: ‘redist’ #> The following object is masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter data(iowa) ia <- redist_map(iowa, existing_plan = cd_2010, pop_tol = 0.01) plans <- redist_smc(ia, 100, silent = TRUE) plans <- plans %>% dplyr::mutate(dvs = group_frac(ia, dem_08, dem_08 + rep_08)) svc(plans, dvs)
